ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Cochlear Meniere's Disease (Left Ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Diagnosed by otologist based on fluctuating low-frequency sensorineural hearing loss, aural fullness, and roaring tinnitus without vertigo.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Single-Sided Deafness (Right Ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Result of right acoustic neuroma removal 1.6 years prior.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Chronic Tinnitus (Bilateral)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Persisting since tumor removal, with recent exacerbation in the left ear associated with Meniere's diagnosis.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess current hearing thresholds given recent fluctuation and history of acoustic neuroma/Meniere's.
To quantify tinnitus severity, functional impact, and psychological distress (SHQ-S, THQ, TPFQ).

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Audiometry confirms profound right-sided deafness and left-sided low-frequency sensorineural hearing loss consistent with Cochlear Meniere's. Self-report measures indicate significant tinnitus distress, particularly affecting emotions and sleep, as well as expected localization deficits.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Profound sensorineural hearing loss/no response. Left ear: Moderate low-frequency SNHL (250 Hz at 65 dB HL, 500 Hz at 55 dB HL) rising to mild/normal in mid-frequencies (2000 Hz at 25 dB HL) and sloping slightly at 8000 Hz (45 dB HL).

tests.name: Self-Report Scales (Questionnaires)
tests.result_summary: SHQ-S Total: 16.7 (poor localization). THQ Total: 40.7 (Hearing subscale 64.2). TPFQ Total: 48.8, with high impact on Emotion (78.3) and Sleep (40.0).

proposed_items: Bi-CROS hearing aid use (up to 12 hours/day for communication and masking)
Low-level sound therapy (nature sounds, music, fan) for sleep and background relief
Keep a diary of thoughts, emotions, and activities related to tinnitus
Client Oriented Scale of Improvement in Tinnitus (COSIT) for goal setting
counseling_actions: Education on tinnitus, hearing loss, and attention
Cognitive restructuring to modify negative thought patterns dictating emotions
Sleep hygiene counseling and review of sleep session of TAT
Discuss relationship between Cochlear Meniere's and fluctuating symptoms
Validate anxiety regarding deafness and social withdrawal

escalation.rationale_short: Patient is already under otologic care for Meniere's; proceed with audiological tinnitus management.

follow_up_plan.objective: Complete Tinnitus Activities Treatment sessions and re-evaluate using questionnaires (TPFQ, COSIT).

expected_outcome: Tinnitus Primary Functions Questionnaire (TPFQ) post-treatment: Significant improvement in reactions to tinnitus, with the Emotion subscale score dropping from ~78 to ~25 and Sleep subscale from ~40 to ~15.

Client Oriented Scale of Improvement in Tinnitus (COSIT) post-treatment: Patient reported reduced hearing difficulties, much improved enjoyment of daily life, and slightly better avoidance of social situations.
Subjective Report: Patient enjoys work and social activities with less fear and anxiety, and has improved reactions to fluctuating tinnitus loudness.
